column5: Well what a night this was! Shawn and his friend Robert were heading back out this evening to do some more Salmon fishing, and his friend was very nice to invite me along. So I went to my nextdoor neighbours and asked if they would look after our daughter so I could FINALLY get out to do some hardcore fishing, and at first my daughter was making such a huge fuss about me leaving her, I gave up and I was not going to go but something was telling me not to give up and to get my butt out on Lake Ontario and Shawn wanted me to go and to try with our daughter one more time, so I did and she finally calmed down and was fine! So Shawn and I finally left and headed to the harbour. We met up with his friend and started to head out.   Once we got to where we wanted to go we all set up our lines. We were in about 80 feet of water and my line was down 45 feet. My line was all set up on a white spin doctor with a white halo fly. About 20 minutes we yelled "FISH ON"  Shawn grabbed the rod and set the hook and I took over and started to reel in. The fish went out at 250 feet and the fish really started to fight and dragged my line to 359 feet! After fighting him and 20 minutes later I FINALLY got this beauty of a fish into the boat! I was too stubborn and fiesty to let this fish win!   After alot of hard work this beauty King Chinook Salmon weighed in at 25.3 lbs and was 37 inches long! This is my FIRST fish of 2007 and this will make a GREAT tribute to TEAM 9!!!!
way to go! very nice fish!!   common shawn, you can do better.. right???
Wow, awesome fish. good show
Beautiful...good on you for getting out there.  Maureen
Thanks guys and gal, it felt really good to catch my first big fish of the year!
Great catch! Thanks for the report!
Ya, I'd call that a Biiiiiig fish!! Congratulations!
Wow, what a beauty     Way to go girl!!!!!  Looks like a fantastic day.  Joey
Nice fish, Congrats
Hey Fishergirl, They are great catching when they are that big, wait to you get a screamer that decides to go to New York. Awesome fish... Great going.
nice fish there glad ya got out for some fun
Nice catch Julie and good to see you out there.Nice hefty fish for you team.WTG  MTP
Wow thats a good one.Good going fishergirl72!

Congrats on the 37" King Fishergirl72!!     Some day i hope to do a charter on the Big O.  Thanks for sharing.  Those inches will look pretty good added to Team 9's "Anglers Anonymous" total.       It even qualifies for the 2 bonus inches at OFAH.  That a possible 39" to Team 9's total.  FOTB
Nice job Julie!! That's one VERYYYY nice fish!!!
Way to go girl!  Congrats on a Lake O hawg     Glad to hear you were able to get out and have some fun!  Aaron
Nice fish ...were did you catch it ....
WOW! Thats a big Salmon. Your arms must have bee burning!

Hey welcome back Fishergirl.  That is an impressive King Chinook Salmon.  Even though I am new to this blog, I am a frequent blogger on Bounty Fishing.  They have fishing competition that begins July 2 where you win cash prizes for the longest fish per specie and its fairly simple all you need to do is send in a picture of the fish you caught with a tape measure next to it.  Bounty Fishing Tournament
Thanks Aaron! It felt really good to finally get out and land that beauty!
Thank you guys and gals for the kind words and compliments, I just wish I could get out alot more than I do but I will take what I can get!
Thanks FOTB!!! and I just entered that baby in the OFAH
well that was a great fish and you gave him a great fight for sure...now lets go get you a bigger one for the salmon derby....cheers
